summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20-CR-330). The order denies the defense's motion to prohibit extrajudicial statements by the government and witness counsel, citing the court's expectation of compliance with existing rules and the defendant's right to a fair trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20-CR-330) who is the subject of the defense motion to restrict extrajudicial statements.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who issued the order denying the defense's motion and warning parties about compliance with court rules.

events.title: Court Order on Motion to Restrict Statements
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan denies Ghislaine Maxwell's defense motion to prohibit the government and witness counsel from making extrajudicial statements about the case, warning of future action if rules are violated.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The defense moved to prohibit the government, its agents, and counsel for witnesses from making extrajudicial statements about the case.
Judge Alison J. Nathan denied the motion without prejudice, citing the court's expectation of compliance with Local Criminal Rule 23.1 and professional responsibility rules.
The court warned that it would take appropriate action if any relevant rules were violated in the future.
The order emphasizes the court's commitment to ensuring the defendant's right to a fair trial by an impartial jury.
